Package models

Class CivBoard

java.lang.Object
models.CivBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class CivBoard
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
Holds the collection of individual tiles that make up a single Civ map.
Author:
Connie Sun, Ryan Smith, Luke Hankins, Tim Gavlick
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    CivBoard​(int size)
    Constructor for our board Map4 has several areas where the elements in those areas are randomly generated, but part of a cohesive "idea" for that area (swamp area contains field, swamp, water).
    CivBoard​(java.io.ObjectInputStream ois)
    Second constructor that will build itself out of a save file
    CivBoard​(java.lang.String file)
    Third constructor for our board that takes a file which contains information on how to build a board, and builds a board out of it.

    serializeBoard() is called when saving the game state to capture all of the board's attributes.

  • Field Details

    • tiles

      public Tile[][] tiles

    • size

      public int size

    • playerStartingCoords

      private java.util.ArrayList<int[]> playerStartingCoords

  • Constructor Details

    • CivBoard

      public CivBoard​(int size)
      Constructor for our board Map4 has several areas where the elements in those areas are randomly generated, but part of a cohesive "idea" for that area (swamp area contains field, swamp, water). This constructor takes a size and creates a size x size map with these areas.
      Parameters:
      size - size provides a size for the board; given size board is size x size

    • CivBoard

      public CivBoard​(java.io.ObjectInputStream ois) throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException, java.io.IOException
      Second constructor that will build itself out of a save file
      Parameters:
      ois - ois is an ObjectInputStream for deserializing an instance of the board class
      Throws:
      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if class cannot be found
      java.io.IOException - if unsuccessful read from ois

    • CivBoard

      public CivBoard​(java.lang.String file)
      Third constructor for our board that takes a file which contains information on how to build a board, and builds a board out of it. Takes files of the form "tile_type resource_type\n" where each line provides information about one tile and its resource
      Parameters:
      file - file with format specified above.

  • Method Details

    • getTile

      public Tile getTile​(int x, int y)
      getTile returns the Tile object at CivBoard's x,y location
      Parameters:
      x - int specifying x location on our board
      y - int specifying y location on our board
      Returns:
      a Tile object that is the tile on our board at x,y

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      getSize() returns this board's size attribute (board is size x size)
      Returns:
      int giving the dimension of this board

    • serializeBoard

      public void serializeBoard​(java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos) throws java.io.IOException
      serializeBoard() is called when saving the game state to capture all of the board's attributes.
      Parameters:
      oos - AnObjectOutputStream to write this board's fields to.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If error when writing to output stream

    • unserializeBoard

      public void unserializeBoard​(java.io.ObjectInputStream ois) throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException, java.io.IOException
      unserializeBoard() is called when attempting to load a saved game state into this board.
      Parameters:
      ois - an ObjectInputSteam to load CivBoard attributes from
      Throws:
      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if class not found
      java.io.IOException - if error reading from input stream
